numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a difference between young people and older people.
2. Many young people believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
3. Fewer older people believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
4. The graph shows data for people who are 15 to 24 years old.
5. In the provided countries, most 15-to-24-year-olds are between 50% and 75% on the X-axis.
6. In the provided countries, no 15-to-24-year-olds are under 25% on the X-axis.
7. The graph shows data for people who are over 40 years old.
8. In most countries, people over 40 are below 50% on the Y-axis.
9. In most countries, a significant number of people over 40 are under 25% on the Y-axis.
10. There is no clearly noticeable trend in the data.
11. Most first-world countries have a higher percentage of optimistic young people than optimistic older people.
12. The US is between 50% and 75% on the X-axis.
13. The UK is between 50% and 75% on the X-axis.
14. Japan is between 50% and 75% on the X-axis.
15. Germany is between 50% and 75% on the X-axis.
16. The US is below 50% on the Y-axis.
17. The UK is below 50% on the Y-axis.
18. Japan is below 50% on the Y-axis.
19. Germany is below 50% on the Y-axis.
20. Indonesia is an anomaly in the result.
21. In Indonesia, young people believe that the world is getting better over time.
22. In Indonesia, older people believe that the world is getting better over time.
23. Indonesia's economy increased by over 600% since 2000.
24. An increase in an economy can increase the quality of life.
25. An increase in an economy can increase the general welfare of a population.
26. These conditions can explain why many people in Indonesia have high hopes for the future.
